column4: unity should be default on livecd, are you installing on an older system or logged into gnome classic?
My box is really sweet, I think it may be the fact I have a Nvidia 9800 gt
Test_:did you install the nvidia additional drivers?
Can you do that on a live cd?
if the box has an internet connection, yes
Yeah I am on the live cd now, but didn't see any restricted drivers pop up
so if unity did not load, are you on classic right now?
Well it seems to be classic
try loggin out and load ubuntu default(unity) and look what error u get
I did that.  The selction says "Ubuntu"
It's not on the classic one
but I think it still is defaulting to classic
i had the same promblem installing on an older system, seems like its switching to default as it does not recognize some drivers maybe?
How did you fix it?  My box is actually quite nice, it's still considered top notch at over 2 years old
did you try a clean install or u still testing on livecd?

Testing on a live cd still.  Going to test unity before I decide to try out Fedora for Gnome 3.  I love gnome, so not to thrilled about the unity bit.  But I know 11.10 has Gnome 3..but that's alpha..so no good for me atm
i highly recommend clean install with installing additional drivers at boot install, unity is great on high end hardware
